likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the Delayed Transition scenario, the likelihood of extreme weather events is expected to increase due to the higher temperature rise (2.5°C) and the associated impacts on climate patterns. The impact also rises as supply chain disruptions and operational challenges become more pronounced, affecting production and distribution.

emerging_opportunities.description: With the increase in extreme weather events, there is potential for Apple to innovate and create Mac hardware that is more durable and reliable under adverse conditions, potentially attracting a new customer base.

additional_challenges.description: Extreme weather events can disrupt global supply chains, affecting the availability of components needed for Mac hardware production, which can lead to delays and increased costs.
The need to adapt facilities and operations to withstand extreme weather events could lead to higher operational costs for the Mac Hardware entity.

mitigation_strategies.description: By diversifying suppliers across different regions, Apple can reduce the risk of supply chain disruptions caused by extreme weather in any single area.
Investing in infrastructure improvements that can withstand extreme weather events will help maintain production levels and reduce downtime.

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Enhanced product testing for extreme conditions
mitigation_strategies.description: Implementing rigorous testing protocols for Mac hardware under extreme weather conditions can lead to improved product durability and customer satisfaction.
